article_title: William Galston: Obama and the Limits of Unilateral Action
article_text:
As President Obama was delivering a speech on immigration reform in November, a heckler interrupted him. "You have the power to stop deportation," the man said. "Actually, I don't," the president replied. He went on to explain his thinking: "The easy way out is to . . . pretend like I can do something by violating our laws. What I'm proposing is the harder path, which is to use our democratic processes to achieve the same goal . . . ."

As Mr. Obama ramps up his use of executive authority, he...

twitter.description: In The Wall Street Journal, William Galston writes that executive orders may seem fast and easy, but they generally are no substitute for legislation.
twitter.title: William Galston: Obama and the Limits of Unilateral Action
